original_conversation.content: [frustrated] Look, I get why the school board doesn't like me hanging around. Ex-con with the tattoos, the record, the whole thing. [short pause] But these kids? They see right through those counselors in their pressed shirts. [chuckle] Kid yesterday literally laughed when the therapist tried to relate to him. [passionate] But when I walked in? Dead silent. They know I'm not playing. I've been where they are—sleeping in cars, stealing to eat, thinking nobody gives a damn about you. [quietly] That's not something you can learn from a textbook. [pause] This one girl, Maya, she wouldn't talk to anyone for weeks. Not teachers, not her foster parents, nobody. [warm] But she saw my ankle monitor that first day, and she just... she asked me straight up what I did. [laugh] And I told her the truth. All of it. [empathetically] Now she tells me things she won't tell anyone else because she knows I won't judge her. I can't. [very sincerely] These kids don't need another adult pretending to understand. They need someone who actually, um... who actually gets what it's like to have everyone write you off. [confidently] So yeah, maybe my reputation is exactly what they need. [trailing off] Maybe that's the whole point...

subject: Your outlaw reputation helping you connect with at-risk kids who won't trust anyone else
